content.description: This climb features some really cool steming going up through what looks like a chimney with no back. This climb can be used to access Reverend Hilti's Bosch or do it all in one pitch.
content.location: Third route from the left.See photo topo

content.description: This is the route on the far left of the wall.Steep and fun! Easy but runout finish.
content.protection: Bolts with a set of anchors at the top.
content.location: First route on the left side of the wall.See the photo topo

content.description: This is the only route that climbs above the ledge on the left hand side of this wall.This pitch offers fewer edges than the rest of the climbs here.This pitch is fun and when combined with one of the first three climbs makes for a longer climb.
content.location: This route is on the left hand side of the cliff and it starts above climb 3, off of a large boulder on the ledge.See photo topo.

content.description: This is the original line on the cliff. A bold and runout route that travels over much loose rock.
content.protection: One pin and one bolt are the fixed protection on this route. Standard rack should get the rest done.There are no anchors on top of this climb. Hike off to the west(down canyon). This route is listed as r/x in the Ruckman Guide and may be x due to poor rock quality.
content.location: Start to the right of climb 5. Climb up a shallow dihedral passing a pin.Move left onto a ledge, step up and clip the routes lone bolt.Walk off.

content.description: You will run into the business end of this climb at 2/3rds height, however several cruxy sections will already be behind you. Cool roof moves over and over. A wild climb!
content.protection: 14 Bolts to a bolted anchor. Consider extending 3,4,7,and 8 to reduce dope drag
content.location: Located to the right of No recess. Bring a 70m or 2 ropes to get down. See photo topo.

content.description: The crux is low on this route but by the time you are done climbing it you may have forgotten. One of my favorites on this cliff. Long Live Nirvana. I was obsessed by the idea of  "Super Routes" (thank Sharma) when I did this route, a super route for mortals. TP and I did the FA with a lead rope and a tag line so we could both lead it.
content.protection:
20 bolts to a bolted anchors.

Belay from the top and rap to the top of Baked Bean Sandwich if you just have one 70m rope.
content.location: This route lies just about the middle of the cliff and makes its way towards the tallest point. 2 ropes needed to get off! A 70 or 80 meter single rope will not get you down! There is the option of rappelling to the anchors at the top of Baked Bean Sandwich and then to the ground. See photo topo.

content.description: Crux is almost at the top. This route might not be as great as Jen's kiss was, but if you climb the crux wrong on this route you might scream her name too!
content.location: This is the first route to the right of the big cleft /corner. See photo topo.

content.description: This route packs in some of the funnest moves on the cliff. Easy but runout finish.You should feel good once you figure this one out!
content.protection: Bolts to a set of anchors.
content.location: Second route from the left.See photo topo

content.description: This climb is on the far left hand side of the Red Rock Wall. Called the "Can't Come Out and Play Wall" the one route in residence here is short but has a nice south western exposure that can keep you warm at the end of a long day.
Second pitch to Baked Bean Sandwich.
content.location: Directly above climb 7 (Baked Bean Sandwich) See photo topo.

content.description: This route stays consistent through out its lenghth.A fun climb to warm up on. Cool moves and features.
content.location: This route is about 60 feet to the right of Red Rock. It follows an in obvious prow.See photo topo.
